info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 17 at 2:20AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...An intense lake effect snow band will affect northeastern Lake... northern Ashtabula and Erie Counties Until 415 AM EST.... At 217 AM EST, radar indicated an intense lake effect snow band along a line extending from 21 miles northwest of Mentor to 7 miles south of North Kingsville to 6 miles southwest of Erie into Western New York. This line will remain nearly stationary through 415 am as individual heavier bursts of snow move eastward at 30 mph. HAZARDS INCLUDE... Visibility rapidly dropping to less than a quarter of a mile... Up to 2 inches of quick snow accumulation... Locations impacted include... Erie, Ashtabula, Conneaut, Geneva-On-The-Lake, Geneva, North East, Madison, Girard, North Kingsville, Perry, Waterford, Albion, Wattsburg, Northwest Harborcreek, Harborcreek, Lawrence Park, Wesleyville, Lake City, Austinburg and Kingsville. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this lake effect snow band. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until this snow band passes your location. && ODOT DMS 332.
